main event: A light was observed in the sky over Waterloo, Iowa, on March 25, 1957.
interesting points: The object was described as having a flame-like light in the rear., The object exhibited a downward dipping motion and was stationary at times., The sighting lasted for approximately 5 minutes., The observer noted that the moon was in position and setting at the time of the sighting., The size of the object was likened to that of a pea in the sky.
sighted object: unknown-shaped light with a flame-like rear
